alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 3:18AM MST until February 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Expect snow showers to increase and become more persistent this afternoon and evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow totals of 2 to 6 inches are expected by this evening. A much more serious storm, containing periods of heavy snow, strong winds and sharply colder temperatures, arrives by late Tuesday morning, lasting through Tuesday night. For the Winter Storm Warning, additional snow totals of 6 to 12 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Alpine, Forest Lakes, Heber- Overgaard, Pinetop-Lakeside, Show Low and Whiteriver. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 11 PM MST this evening. For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon Tuesday to 6 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...For today, expect travel delays due to snow covered roads. For Tuesday, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow tables below are for the Winter Storm Warning only. Snow forecast from noon Tuesday to 6 AM Wednesday: Alpine 7 to 11 inches Forest Lakes 14 to 20 inches Heber-Overgaard 7 to 11 inches Pinetop-Lkside 9 to 15 inches Show Low 9 to 13 inches Whiteriver 4 to 8 inches .
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
